texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 132. Abetment of mutiny, if mutiny is committed in consequence thereof . -Whoever abets the committing of mutiny by an officer, soldier, 8 [sailor or airman], in the Army, 9 [Navy or Air Force] of the 10 [Government of India], shall, if mutiny be committed in consequence of that abetment, be punished with death  or  with 11 [imprisonment  for  life],  or  imprisonment  of  either  description  for  a  term  which  may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
texts.text: Abetment of mutiny, if mutiny is committed in consequence thereof . -Whoever abets the committing of mutiny by an officer, soldier, 8 [sailor or airman], in the Army, 9 [Navy or Air Force] of the 10 [Government of India], shall, if mutiny be committed in consequence of that abetment, be punished with death  or  with 11 [imprisonment  for  life],  or  imprisonment  of  either  description  for  a  term  which  may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 133. Abetment of assault by soldier, sailor or airman on his superior officer, when in execution of his office . -Whoever abets an assault by an officer, soldier, 8 [sailor or airman], in the Army, 9 [Navy or Air Force] of the 10 [Government of India], on any superior officer being in the execution of his office, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.
texts.text: Abetment of assault by soldier, sailor or airman on his superior officer, when in execution of his office . -Whoever abets an assault by an officer, soldier, 8 [sailor or airman], in the Army, 9 [Navy or Air Force] of the 10 [Government of India], on any superior officer being in the execution of his office, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 134. Abetment of such assault, if the assault committed . -Whoever abets an assault by an officer, soldier, 8 [sailor  or  airman],  in  the  Army, 9 [Navy or Air Force] of the 10 [Government of India], on any superior officer being in the execution of his office, shall, if such assault be committed in consequence of that abetment be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.
texts.text: Abetment of such assault, if the assault committed . -Whoever abets an assault by an officer, soldier, 8 [sailor  or  airman],  in  the  Army, 9 [Navy or Air Force] of the 10 [Government of India], on any superior officer being in the execution of his office, shall, if such assault be committed in consequence of that abetment be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 135.  Abetment  of  desertion  of  soldier,  sailor  or  airman . -Whoever, abets  the  desertion  of  any officer,  soldier, 8 [sailor  or airman], in the Army, 9 [Navy or Air Force] of the 10 [Government of India], shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Abetment  of  desertion  of  soldier,  sailor  or  airman . -Whoever, abets  the  desertion  of  any officer,  soldier, 8 [sailor  or airman], in the Army, 9 [Navy or Air Force] of the 10 [Government of India], shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 136. Harbouring deserter . -Whoever, except as hereinafter excepted, knowing or having reason to believe  that  an  officer,  soldier, 8 [sailor  or  airman],  in  the  Army, 9 [Navy  or  Air  Force]  of  the 10 [Government  of  India],  has  deserted,  harbours  such  officer,  soldier, 8 [sailor  or  airman],  shall  be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine or with both.
texts.text: 136. Harbouring deserter . -Whoever, except as hereinafter excepted, knowing or having reason to believe  that  an  officer,  soldier, 8 [sailor  or  airman],  in  the  Army, 9 [Navy  or  Air  Force]  of  the 10 [Government  of  India],  has  deserted,  harbours  such  officer,  soldier, 8 [sailor  or  airman],  shall  be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine or with both.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Exception . -This provision does not extend to the case in which the harbour is given by a wife to her husband.
texts.text: Exception . -This provision does not extend to the case in which the harbour is given by a wife to her husband.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 137. Deserter concealed on board merchant vessel through negligence of master . -The master or person in charge of a  merchant vessel, on board of which any deserter from the Army, 9 [Navy or Air Force] of the 10 [Government of India] is concealed, shall, though ignorant of such concealment, be liable to a penalty not exceeding five hundred rupees, if he might have known of such concealment but for some neglect of his duty as such master or person in charge, or but for some want of discipline on board of the vessel.
texts.text: Deserter concealed on board merchant vessel through negligence of master . -The master or person in charge of a  merchant vessel, on board of which any deserter from the Army, 9 [Navy or Air Force] of the 10 [Government of India] is concealed, shall, though ignorant of such concealment, be liable to a penalty not exceeding five hundred rupees, if he might have known of such concealment but for some neglect of his duty as such master or person in charge, or but for some want of discipline on board of the vessel.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 138. Abetment of act of insubordination by soldier, sailor or airman . -Whoever abets what he knows to be an act of insubordination by an officer, soldier, 8 [sailor or airman], in the Army, 9 [Navy or air Force], of the 10 [Government of India], shall, if such act of insubordination be committed in consequence of that abetment, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: 138. Abetment of act of insubordination by soldier, sailor or airman . -Whoever abets what he knows to be an act of insubordination by an officer, soldier, 8 [sailor or airman], in the Army, 9 [Navy or air Force], of the 10 [Government of India], shall, if such act of insubordination be committed in consequence of that abetment, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

Persons subject to certain Acts . -No person subject to 2 [the Army Act, 3 [the Army Act, 1950 (46 of 1950)], the Naval Discipline Act, 4 [ 5 *** 6 [the Indian Navy (Discipline) Act, 1934 (34 of 1934)], 7 [the Air Force Act or 8 [the Air Force Act, 1950 (45 of 1950)]]], is subject to punishment under this Code Code for any of the offences defined in this Chapter.
texts.text: 139. Persons subject to certain Acts . -No person subject to 2 [the Army Act, 3 [the Army Act, 1950 (46 of 1950)], the Naval Discipline Act, 4 [ 5 *** 6 [the Indian Navy (Discipline) Act, 1934 (34 of 1934)], 7 [the Air Force Act or 8 [the Air Force Act, 1950 (45 of 1950)]]], is subject to punishment under this Code Code for any of the offences defined in this Chapter.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 140. Wearing garb or carrying token used by soldier, sailor or airman . -Whoever, not being a soldier, 9 [sailor or airman] in the Military, 10 [Naval or Air] service of the 11 [Government of India], wears any garb or carries any token resembling any garb or token used by such a soldier, 9 [sailor or airman] with the intention that it may be believed that he is such a soldier, 9 [sailor or airman], shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Wearing garb or carrying token used by soldier, sailor or airman . -Whoever, not being a soldier, 9 [sailor or airman] in the Military, 10 [Naval or Air] service of the 11 [Government of India], wears any garb or carries any token resembling any garb or token used by such a soldier, 9 [sailor or airman] with the intention that it may be believed that he is such a soldier, 9 [sailor or airman], shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 141.  Unlawful  assembly . -An  assembly  of  five  or  more  persons  is  designated  an ' unlawful assembly ' , if the common object of the persons composing that assembly is -
texts.text: Unlawful  assembly . -An  assembly  of  five  or  more  persons  is  designated  an ' unlawful assembly ' , if the common object of the persons composing that assembly is -

texts.label: text
texts.orig: First . -To  overawe  by  criminal  force,  or  show  of  criminal  force, 12 [the  Central  or  any  State Government or Parliament or the Legislature of any State], or any public servant in the exercise of the lawful power of such public servant; or
texts.text: First . -To  overawe  by  criminal  force,  or  show  of  criminal  force, 12 [the  Central  or  any  State Government or Parliament or the Legislature of any State], or any public servant in the exercise of the lawful power of such public servant; or

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Second . -To resist the execution of any law, or of any legal process; or
texts.text: Second . -To resist the execution of any law, or of any legal process; or

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Third . -To commit any mischief or criminal trespass, or other offence; or
texts.text: Third . -To commit any mischief or criminal trespass, or other offence; or

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Fourth . -By means of criminal force, or show of criminal force,  to  any  person,  to  take  or  obtain possession of any property, or to deprive any person of the enjoyment of a right of way, or of the use of water  or  other  incorporeal  right  of  which  he  is  in  possession  or  enjoyment,  or  to  enforce  any  right  or supposed right; or
texts.text: Fourth . -By means of criminal force, or show of criminal force,  to  any  person,  to  take  or  obtain possession of any property, or to deprive any person of the enjoyment of a right of way, or of the use of water  or  other  incorporeal  right  of  which  he  is  in  possession  or  enjoyment,  or  to  enforce  any  right  or supposed right; or

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Fifth . -By means of criminal force, or show of criminal force, to compel any person to do what he is not legally bound to do, or to omit to do what he is legally entitled to do.
texts.text: Fifth . -By means of criminal force, or show of criminal force, to compel any person to do what he is not legally bound to do, or to omit to do what he is legally entitled to do.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation . -An assembly which was not unlawful when it assembled, may subsequently become an unlawful assembly.
texts.text: Explanation . -An assembly which was not unlawful when it assembled, may subsequently become an unlawful assembly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 142.  Being  member  of  unlawful  assembly . -Whoever,  being  aware  of  facts  which  render  any assembly  an  unlawful  assembly,  intentionally  joins  that  assembly,  or  continues  in  it,  is  said  to  be  a member of an unlawful assembly.
texts.text: Being  member  of  unlawful  assembly . -Whoever,  being  aware  of  facts  which  render  any assembly  an  unlawful  assembly,  intentionally  joins  that  assembly,  or  continues  in  it,  is  said  to  be  a member of an unlawful assembly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 143.  Punishment . -Whoever  is  a  member  of  an  unlawful  assembly,  shall  be  punished  with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Punishment . -Whoever  is  a  member  of  an  unlawful  assembly,  shall  be  punished  with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 144.  Joining  unlawful  assembly  armed  with  deadly  weapon . -Whoever, being  armed  with  any deadly  weapon,  or  with  anything  which,  used  as  a  weapon  of  offence,  is  likely  to  cause  death,  is  a member of an unlawful assembly, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Joining  unlawful  assembly  armed  with  deadly  weapon . -Whoever, being  armed  with  any deadly  weapon,  or  with  anything  which,  used  as  a  weapon  of  offence,  is  likely  to  cause  death,  is  a member of an unlawful assembly, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 145.  Joining  or  continuing  in  unlawful  assembly,  knowing  it  has  been  commanded  to disperse . -Whoever joins or continues in an unlawful assembly, knowing that such unlawful assembly has been commanded in the manner prescribed by law to disperse, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extent to two years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Joining  or  continuing  in  unlawful  assembly,  knowing  it  has  been  commanded  to disperse . -Whoever joins or continues in an unlawful assembly, knowing that such unlawful assembly has been commanded in the manner prescribed by law to disperse, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extent to two years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 146.  Rioting . -Whenever force  or  violence  is  used  by  an  unlawful  assembly,  or  by  any  member thereof, in prosecution of the common object of such assembly, every member of such assembly is guilty of the offence of rioting.
texts.text: Rioting . -Whenever force  or  violence  is  used  by  an  unlawful  assembly,  or  by  any  member thereof, in prosecution of the common object of such assembly, every member of such assembly is guilty of the offence of rioting.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 147. Punishment for rioting . -Whoever is guilty of rioting, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Punishment for rioting . -Whoever is guilty of rioting, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 148. Rioting, armed with deadly weapon . -Whoever is guilty of rioting, being armed with a deadly weapon or with anything which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Rioting, armed with deadly weapon . -Whoever is guilty of rioting, being armed with a deadly weapon or with anything which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 149. Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object . -If  an  offence  is  committed  by  any  member  of  an  unlawful  assembly  in  prosecution  of  the common  object  of  that  assembly,  or  such  as  the  members  of  that  assembly  knew  to  be  likely  to  be committed in prosecution of that object, every person who, at the time of the committing of that offence, is a member of the same assembly, is guilty of that offence.
texts.text: Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object . -If  an  offence  is  committed  by  any  member  of  an  unlawful  assembly  in  prosecution  of  the common  object  of  that  assembly,  or  such  as  the  members  of  that  assembly  knew  to  be  likely  to  be committed in prosecution of that object, every person who, at the time of the committing of that offence, is a member of the same assembly, is guilty of that offence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 150.  Hiring,  or  conniving  at  hiring,  of  persons  to  join  unlawful  assembly . -Whoever hires  or engages, or employs, or promotes, or connives at the hiring, engagement or employment of any person to join or become a member of any unlawful assembly, shall be punishable as a member of such unlawful assembly,  and  for  any  offence  which  may  be  committed  by  any  such  person  as  a  member  of  such unlawful assembly in pursuance of such hiring, engagement or employment, in the same manner as if he had been a member of such unlawful assembly, or himself had committed such offence.
texts.text: Hiring,  or  conniving  at  hiring,  of  persons  to  join  unlawful  assembly . -Whoever hires  or engages, or employs, or promotes, or connives at the hiring, engagement or employment of any person to join or become a member of any unlawful assembly, shall be punishable as a member of such unlawful assembly,  and  for  any  offence  which  may  be  committed  by  any  such  person  as  a  member  of  such unlawful assembly in pursuance of such hiring, engagement or employment, in the same manner as if he had been a member of such unlawful assembly, or himself had committed such offence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 151.  Knowingly  joining  or  continuing  in  assembly  of  five  or  more  persons  after  it  has  been commanded  to  disperse . -Whoever  knowingly  joins  or  continues  in  any  assembly  of  five  or  more persons  likely  to  cause  a  disturbance  of  the  public  peace,  after  such  assembly  has  been  lawfully commanded to disperse, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Knowingly  joining  or  continuing  in  assembly  of  five  or  more  persons  after  it  has  been commanded  to  disperse . -Whoever  knowingly  joins  or  continues  in  any  assembly  of  five  or  more persons  likely  to  cause  a  disturbance  of  the  public  peace,  after  such  assembly  has  been  lawfully commanded to disperse, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Explanation . -If  the  assembly  is  an  unlawful  assembly  within  the  meaning  of  section  141,  the offender will be punishable under section 145.
texts.text: Explanation . -If  the  assembly  is  an  unlawful  assembly  within  the  meaning  of  section  141,  the offender will be punishable under section 145.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 152. Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot, etc . -Whoever assaults or threatens to assault, or obstructs or attempts to obstruct, any public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant, in endeavouring to disperse an unlawful assembly, or to suppress a riot or affray, or uses,  or  threatens,  or  attempts  to  use  criminal  force  to  such  public  servant,  shall  be  punished  with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot, etc . -Whoever assaults or threatens to assault, or obstructs or attempts to obstruct, any public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant, in endeavouring to disperse an unlawful assembly, or to suppress a riot or affray, or uses,  or  threatens,  or  attempts  to  use  criminal  force  to  such  public  servant,  shall  be  punished  with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 153.  Wantonly  giving  provocation  with  intent  to  cause  riot -if  rioting  be  committed;  if  not committed. -Whoever malignantly, or wantonly by doing anything which is illegal, gives provocation to any person intending or knowing it to be likely that such provocation will cause the offence of rioting to be  committed,  shall,  if  the  offence  of  rioting  be  committed  in  consequence  of  such  provocation,  be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both; and if the offence of rioting be not committed, with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Wantonly  giving  provocation  with  intent  to  cause  riot -if  rioting  be  committed;  if  not committed. -Whoever malignantly, or wantonly by doing anything which is illegal, gives provocation to any person intending or knowing it to be likely that such provocation will cause the offence of rioting to be  committed,  shall,  if  the  offence  of  rioting  be  committed  in  consequence  of  such  provocation,  be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both; and if the offence of rioting be not committed, with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 2 [153AA. Punishment for knowingly carrying arms in any procession or organising, or holding or taking part in any mass drill or mass training with arms . -Whoever knowingly carries arms in any procession or organizes or holds or takes part in any mass drill or mass training with arms in any public place in contravention of any public notice or order issued or made under section 144A of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 (2 of 1974) shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months and with fine which may extend to two thousand rupees.
texts.text: 2 [153AA. Punishment for knowingly carrying arms in any procession or organising, or holding or taking part in any mass drill or mass training with arms . -Whoever knowingly carries arms in any procession or organizes or holds or takes part in any mass drill or mass training with arms in any public place in contravention of any public notice or order issued or made under section 144A of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 (2 of 1974) shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months and with fine which may extend to two thousand rupees.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation . -'Arms' means articles of any description designed or adapted as weapons for offence or defence and includes firearms, sharp edged weapons, lathis , dandas and sticks].
texts.text: Explanation . -'Arms' means articles of any description designed or adapted as weapons for offence or defence and includes firearms, sharp edged weapons, lathis , dandas and sticks].

texts.orig: ( a ) makes or publishes any imputation that any class of persons cannot, by reason of their being members of any religious, racial, language or regional group or caste or community, bear true faith and  allegiance  to  the  Constitution  of  India  as  by  law  established  or  uphold  the  sovereignty  and integrity of India, or
texts.text: ( a ) makes or publishes any imputation that any class of persons cannot, by reason of their being members of any religious, racial, language or regional group or caste or community, bear true faith and  allegiance  to  the  Constitution  of  India  as  by  law  established  or  uphold  the  sovereignty  and integrity of India, or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( b ) asserts, counsels, advises, propagates or publishes that any class of persons shall, by reason of their being members of any religious, racial, language or regional group or caste or community, be denied, or deprived of their rights as citizens of India, or
texts.text: ( b ) asserts, counsels, advises, propagates or publishes that any class of persons shall, by reason of their being members of any religious, racial, language or regional group or caste or community, be denied, or deprived of their rights as citizens of India, or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( c )  makes  or  publishes and  assertion, counsel,  plea or  appeal concerning  the  obligation  of  any class of persons, by reason of their being members of any religious, racial, language or regional group or  caste  or  community,  and  such  assertion,  counsel,  plea  or  appeal  causes  or  is  likely  to  cause disharmony or feelings of enmity or hatred or ill-will between such members and other persons,
texts.text: ( c )  makes  or  publishes and  assertion, counsel,  plea or  appeal concerning  the  obligation  of  any class of persons, by reason of their being members of any religious, racial, language or regional group or  caste  or  community,  and  such  assertion,  counsel,  plea  or  appeal  causes  or  is  likely  to  cause disharmony or feelings of enmity or hatred or ill-will between such members and other persons,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( 2 )  Whoever  commits  an  offence  specified  in  sub-section  ( 1 )  in  any  place  of  worship  or  in  any assembly engaged in the performance of religious worship or religious ceremonies, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to five years and shall also be liable to fine.]
texts.text: ( 2 )  Whoever  commits  an  offence  specified  in  sub-section  ( 1 )  in  any  place  of  worship  or  in  any assembly engaged in the performance of religious worship or religious ceremonies, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to five years and shall also be liable to fine.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 154. Owner or occupier of land on which an unlawful assembly is held . -Whenever any unlawful assembly or riot takes place, the owner or occupier of the land upon which such unlawful assembly is held,  or  such  riot  is  committed,  and  any  person  having  or  claiming  an  interest  in  such  land,  shall  be punishable with fine not exceeding one thousand rupees, if he or his agent or manager, knowing that such offence is being or has been committed, or having reason to believe it is likely to be committed, do not give the earliest notice thereof in his or their power to the principal officer at the nearest police-station,
texts.text: Owner or occupier of land on which an unlawful assembly is held . -Whenever any unlawful assembly or riot takes place, the owner or occupier of the land upon which such unlawful assembly is held,  or  such  riot  is  committed,  and  any  person  having  or  claiming  an  interest  in  such  land,  shall  be punishable with fine not exceeding one thousand rupees, if he or his agent or manager, knowing that such offence is being or has been committed, or having reason to believe it is likely to be committed, do not give the earliest notice thereof in his or their power to the principal officer at the nearest police-station,

texts.label: footnote
texts.orig: 1. Ins. by Act 31 of 1972, s. 2.
texts.text: 1. Ins. by Act 31 of 1972, s. 2.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: and do not, in the case of his or their having reason to believe that it was about to be committed, use all lawful means in his or their power to prevent it and, in the event of its taking place, do not use all lawful means in his or their power to disperse or suppress the riot or unlawful assembly.
texts.text: and do not, in the case of his or their having reason to believe that it was about to be committed, use all lawful means in his or their power to prevent it and, in the event of its taking place, do not use all lawful means in his or their power to disperse or suppress the riot or unlawful assembly.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 155. Liability of person for whose benefit riot is committed . -Whenever a riot is committed for the benefit or on behalf of any person who is the owner or occupier of any land respecting which such riot takes place or who claims any interest in such land, or in the subject of any dispute which gave rise to the riot, or who has accepted or derived any benefit therefrom, such person shall be punishable with fine, if he or his agent or manager, having reason to believe that such riot was likely to be committed or that the unlawful assembly by which such riot was committed was likely to be held, shall not respectively use all lawful means in his or their power to prevent such assembly or riot from taking place, and for suppressing and dispersing the same.
texts.text: 155. Liability of person for whose benefit riot is committed . -Whenever a riot is committed for the benefit or on behalf of any person who is the owner or occupier of any land respecting which such riot takes place or who claims any interest in such land, or in the subject of any dispute which gave rise to the riot, or who has accepted or derived any benefit therefrom, such person shall be punishable with fine, if he or his agent or manager, having reason to believe that such riot was likely to be committed or that the unlawful assembly by which such riot was committed was likely to be held, shall not respectively use all lawful means in his or their power to prevent such assembly or riot from taking place, and for suppressing and dispersing the same.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 156. Liability of agent of owner or occupier for whose benefit riot is committed . -Whenever a riot  is  committed for the benefit or on behalf of any person who is the owner or occupier of any land respecting which such riot takes place, or who claims any interest in such land, or in the subject of any dispute which gave rise to the riot, or who has accepted or derived any benefit therefrom, the agent or manager of such person shall be punishable with fine, if such agent or manager, having reason to believe that such riot was likely to be committed, or that the unlawful assembly by which such riot was committed was likely to be held, shall not use all lawful means in his power to prevent such riot or assembly from taking place and for suppressing and dispersing the same.
texts.text: 156. Liability of agent of owner or occupier for whose benefit riot is committed . -Whenever a riot  is  committed for the benefit or on behalf of any person who is the owner or occupier of any land respecting which such riot takes place, or who claims any interest in such land, or in the subject of any dispute which gave rise to the riot, or who has accepted or derived any benefit therefrom, the agent or manager of such person shall be punishable with fine, if such agent or manager, having reason to believe that such riot was likely to be committed, or that the unlawful assembly by which such riot was committed was likely to be held, shall not use all lawful means in his power to prevent such riot or assembly from taking place and for suppressing and dispersing the same.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 157.  Harbouring  persons  hired  for  an  unlawful  assembly . -Whoever  harbours,  receives  or assembles,  in  any  house  or  premises  in  his  occupation  or  charge,  or  under  his  control  any  persons knowing that such persons have been hired, engaged or employed, or are about to be hired, engaged or employed, to join or become members of an unlawful assembly, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Harbouring  persons  hired  for  an  unlawful  assembly . -Whoever  harbours,  receives  or assembles,  in  any  house  or  premises  in  his  occupation  or  charge,  or  under  his  control  any  persons knowing that such persons have been hired, engaged or employed, or are about to be hired, engaged or employed, to join or become members of an unlawful assembly, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 158. Being hired to take part in an unlawful assembly or riot . -Whoever is engaged, or hired, or offers or attempts to be hired or engaged, to do or assist in doing any of the acts specified in section 141, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both,
texts.text: Being hired to take part in an unlawful assembly or riot . -Whoever is engaged, or hired, or offers or attempts to be hired or engaged, to do or assist in doing any of the acts specified in section 141, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: or to go armed . -and whoever, being so engaged or hired as aforesaid, goes armed, or engages or offers to go armed, with any deadly weapon or with anything which used as a weapon of offence is likely to cause death, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: or to go armed . -and whoever, being so engaged or hired as aforesaid, goes armed, or engages or offers to go armed, with any deadly weapon or with anything which used as a weapon of offence is likely to cause death, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 159. Affray . -When two or more persons, by fighting in a public place, disturb the public peace, they are said to ' commit an affray ' .
texts.text: Affray . -When two or more persons, by fighting in a public place, disturb the public peace, they are said to ' commit an affray ' .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 160.  Punishment  for  committing  affray . -Whoever  commits  an  affray,  shall  be  punished  with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Punishment  for  committing  affray . -Whoever  commits  an  affray,  shall  be  punished  with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees, or with both.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CHAPTER IX
texts.text: CHAPTER IX

texts.label: text
texts.orig: OFOFFENCES BY OR RELATING TO PUBLIC SERVANTS
texts.text: OFOFFENCES BY OR RELATING TO PUBLIC SERVANTS

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 161 to 165A . Rep. by the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 ( 49 of 1988 ), s. 31 .
texts.text: 161 to 165A . Rep. by the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 ( 49 of 1988 ), s. 31 .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 166. Public servant disobeying law, with intent to cause injury to any person . -Whoever, being a public  servant,  knowingly  disobeys  any  direction  of  the  law  as  to  the  way  in  which  he  is  to  conduct himself  as  such  public  servant,  intending  to  cause,  or  knowing  it  to  be  likely  that  he  will  by  such disobedience, cause injury to any person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: 166. Public servant disobeying law, with intent to cause injury to any person . -Whoever, being a public  servant,  knowingly  disobeys  any  direction  of  the  law  as  to  the  way  in  which  he  is  to  conduct himself  as  such  public  servant,  intending  to  cause,  or  knowing  it  to  be  likely  that  he  will  by  such disobedience, cause injury to any person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: IIIustration
texts.text: IIIustration

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A, being an officer directed by law to take property in execution, in order to satisfy a decree pronounced in Z's favour by a Court of Justice, knowingly disobeys that direction of law, with the knowledge that he is likely thereby to cause injury to Z. A has committed the offence defined in this section.
texts.text: A, being an officer directed by law to take property in execution, in order to satisfy a decree pronounced in Z's favour by a Court of Justice, knowingly disobeys that direction of law, with the knowledge that he is likely thereby to cause injury to Z. A has committed the offence defined in this section.

texts.label: text

texts.text: 1 [166A. Public servant disobeying direction under law . -Whoever, being a public servant, -

texts.orig: ( a )  knowingly  disobeys  any  direction  of  the  law  which  prohibits  him  from  requiring  the attendance at any place of any person for the purpose of investigation into an offence or any other matter, or
texts.text: ( a )  knowingly  disobeys  any  direction  of  the  law  which  prohibits  him  from  requiring  the attendance at any place of any person for the purpose of investigation into an offence or any other matter, or

texts.text: ( b ) knowingly disobeys, to the prejudice of any person, any other direction of the law regulating the manner in which he shall conduct such investigation, or

texts.label: text
texts.orig: shall  be  punished  with  rigorous  imprisonment  for  a  term  which  shall  not  be  less  than  six  months  but which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.
texts.text: shall  be  punished  with  rigorous  imprisonment  for  a  term  which  shall  not  be  less  than  six  months  but which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 166B. Punishment for non-treatment of victim . -Whoever, being in charge of a hospital, public or private, whether run by the Central Government, the State Government, local bodies or any other person, contravenes the provisions of section 357C of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 (2 of 1974), shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year or with fine or with both.]
texts.text: 166B. Punishment for non-treatment of victim . -Whoever, being in charge of a hospital, public or private, whether run by the Central Government, the State Government, local bodies or any other person, contravenes the provisions of section 357C of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 (2 of 1974), shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year or with fine or with both.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 167. Public servant framing an incorrect document with intent to cause injury . -Whoever, being a public servant, and being, as 2 [such public servant, charged with the preparation or translation of any document  or  electronic  record,  frames,  prepares  or  translates  that  document  or  electronic  record]  in  a manner which he knows or believes to be incorrect, intending thereby to cause or knowing it to be likely that he may thereby cause injury to any person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Public servant framing an incorrect document with intent to cause injury . -Whoever, being a public servant, and being, as 2 [such public servant, charged with the preparation or translation of any document  or  electronic  record,  frames,  prepares  or  translates  that  document  or  electronic  record]  in  a manner which he knows or believes to be incorrect, intending thereby to cause or knowing it to be likely that he may thereby cause injury to any person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 168. Public servant unlawfully engaging in trade . -Whoever, being a public servant, and being legally  bound  as  such  public  servant  not  to  engage  in  trade,  engages  in  trade,  shall  be  punished  with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Public servant unlawfully engaging in trade . -Whoever, being a public servant, and being legally  bound  as  such  public  servant  not  to  engage  in  trade,  engages  in  trade,  shall  be  punished  with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 169. Public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property . -Whoever, being a public servant, and being legally bound as such public servant, not to purchase or bid for certain property, purchases or bids  for  that  property,  either  in  his  own  name  or  in  the  name  of  another,  or  jointly,  or  in  shares  with others, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both; and the property, if purchased, shall be confiscated.
texts.text: Public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property . -Whoever, being a public servant, and being legally bound as such public servant, not to purchase or bid for certain property, purchases or bids  for  that  property,  either  in  his  own  name  or  in  the  name  of  another,  or  jointly,  or  in  shares  with others, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both; and the property, if purchased, shall be confiscated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 170.  Personating  a  public  servant . -Whoever  pretends  to  hold  any  particular  office  as  a  public servant, knowing that he does not hold such office or falsely personates any other person holding such office, and in such assumed character does or attempts to do any act under colour of such office, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Personating  a  public  servant . -Whoever  pretends  to  hold  any  particular  office  as  a  public servant, knowing that he does not hold such office or falsely personates any other person holding such office, and in such assumed character does or attempts to do any act under colour of such office, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 171. Wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant with fraudulent intent . -Whoever, not belonging to a certain class of public servants, wears any garb or carries any token resembling any garb or token used by that class of public servants, with the intention that it may be believed, or with the knowledge  that  it  is  likely  to  be  believed,  that  he  belongs  to  that  class  of  public  servants,  shall  be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant with fraudulent intent . -Whoever, not belonging to a certain class of public servants, wears any garb or carries any token resembling any garb or token used by that class of public servants, with the intention that it may be believed, or with the knowledge  that  it  is  likely  to  be  believed,  that  he  belongs  to  that  class  of  public  servants,  shall  be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees, or with both.

texts.orig: ( b ) ' electoral right ' means the right of a person to stand, or not to stand as, or to withdraw from being, a candidate or to vote or refrain from voting at an election.
texts.text: ( b ) ' electoral right ' means the right of a person to stand, or not to stand as, or to withdraw from being, a candidate or to vote or refrain from voting at an election.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 171B. Bribery . -( 1 ) Whoever -
texts.text: 171B. Bribery . -( 1 ) Whoever -

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( i )  gives  a  gratification  to  any  person  with  the  object  of  inducing  him  or  any  other  person  to exercise any electoral right or of rewarding any person for having exercised any such right; or
texts.text: ( i )  gives  a  gratification  to  any  person  with  the  object  of  inducing  him  or  any  other  person  to exercise any electoral right or of rewarding any person for having exercised any such right; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( ii ) accepts either for himself or for any other person any gratification as a reward for exercising any such right or for inducing or attempting to induce any other person to exercise any such right,
texts.text: ( ii ) accepts either for himself or for any other person any gratification as a reward for exercising any such right or for inducing or attempting to induce any other person to exercise any such right,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: commits the offence of bribery:
texts.text: commits the offence of bribery:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Provided  that  a  declaration  of  public  policy  or  a  promise  of  public  action  shall  not  be  an  offence under this section.
texts.text: Provided  that  a  declaration  of  public  policy  or  a  promise  of  public  action  shall  not  be  an  offence under this section.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( 2 )  A person who offers, or agrees to give, or offers or attempts to procure, a gratification shall be deemed to give a gratification.
texts.text: ( 2 )  A person who offers, or agrees to give, or offers or attempts to procure, a gratification shall be deemed to give a gratification.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( 3 ) A person who obtains or agrees to accept or attempts to obtain a gratification shall be deemed to accept a gratification, and a person who accepts a gratification as a motive for doing what he does not intend  to  do,  or  as  a  reward  for  doing  what  he  has  not  done,  shall  be  deemed  to  have  accepted  the gratification as a reward.
texts.text: ( 3 ) A person who obtains or agrees to accept or attempts to obtain a gratification shall be deemed to accept a gratification, and a person who accepts a gratification as a motive for doing what he does not intend  to  do,  or  as  a  reward  for  doing  what  he  has  not  done,  shall  be  deemed  to  have  accepted  the gratification as a reward.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 171C.  Undue  influence  at  elections . -( 1 )  Whoever  voluntarily  interferes  or  attempts  to  interfere with the free exercise of any electoral right commits the offence of undue influence at an election.
texts.text: 171C.  Undue  influence  at  elections . -( 1 )  Whoever  voluntarily  interferes  or  attempts  to  interfere with the free exercise of any electoral right commits the offence of undue influence at an election.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( 2 ) Without prejudice to the generality of the provisions of sub-section ( 1 ), whoever -
texts.text: ( 2 ) Without prejudice to the generality of the provisions of sub-section ( 1 ), whoever -

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( a )  threatens  any  candidate or voter, or any person in whom a candidate or voter is interested, with injury of any kind, or
texts.text: ( a )  threatens  any  candidate or voter, or any person in whom a candidate or voter is interested, with injury of any kind, or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( b ) induces or attempts to induce a candidate or voter to believe that he or any person in whom he is interested will become or will be rendered an object of Divine displeasure or of spiritual censure,
texts.text: ( b ) induces or attempts to induce a candidate or voter to believe that he or any person in whom he is interested will become or will be rendered an object of Divine displeasure or of spiritual censure,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: shall be deemed to interfere with the free exercise of the electoral right of such candidate or voter, within the meaning of sub-section ( 1 ).
texts.text: shall be deemed to interfere with the free exercise of the electoral right of such candidate or voter, within the meaning of sub-section ( 1 ).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( 3 ) A declaration of public policy or a promise of public action or the mere exercise or a legal right without  intent  to  interfere  with  an  electoral  right,  shall  not  be  deemed  to  be  interference  within  the meaning of this section.
texts.text: ( 3 ) A declaration of public policy or a promise of public action or the mere exercise or a legal right without  intent  to  interfere  with  an  electoral  right,  shall  not  be  deemed  to  be  interference  within  the meaning of this section.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 171D. Personation at elections . -Whoever at an election applies for a voting paper on votes in the name of any other person, whether living or dead, or in a fictitious name, or who having voted once at such  election  applies  at  the  same  election  for  a  voting  paper  in  his  own  name,  and  whoever  abets, procures  or  attempts  to  procure  the  voting  by  any  person  in  any  such  way,  commits  the  offence  of personation at an election.
texts.text: 171D. Personation at elections . -Whoever at an election applies for a voting paper on votes in the name of any other person, whether living or dead, or in a fictitious name, or who having voted once at such  election  applies  at  the  same  election  for  a  voting  paper  in  his  own  name,  and  whoever  abets, procures  or  attempts  to  procure  the  voting  by  any  person  in  any  such  way,  commits  the  offence  of personation at an election.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 1 [Provided  that  nothing  in  this  section  shall  apply  to  a  person  who  has  been  authorised  to  vote  as proxy for an elector under any law for the time being in force in so far as he votes as a proxy for such elector.]
texts.text: 1 [Provided  that  nothing  in  this  section  shall  apply  to  a  person  who  has  been  authorised  to  vote  as proxy for an elector under any law for the time being in force in so far as he votes as a proxy for such elector.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 171E. Punishment for bribery . -Whoever commits the offence of bribery shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both:
texts.text: 171E. Punishment for bribery . -Whoever commits the offence of bribery shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Provided that bribery by treating shall be punished with fine only.
texts.text: Provided that bribery by treating shall be punished with fine only.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation . -' Treating ' means that form of bribery where the gratification consists in food, drink, entertainment, or provision.
texts.text: Explanation . -' Treating ' means that form of bribery where the gratification consists in food, drink, entertainment, or provision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 171F.  Punishment  for  undue  influence  or  personation  at  an  election . -Whoever  commits  the offence of undue influence or personation at an election shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: 171F.  Punishment  for  undue  influence  or  personation  at  an  election . -Whoever  commits  the offence of undue influence or personation at an election shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: footnote
texts.orig: 1. The proviso ins. by Act 24 of 2003, s. 5 (w.e.f. 22-9-2003).
texts.text: 1. The proviso ins. by Act 24 of 2003, s. 5 (w.e.f. 22-9-2003).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 171G. False statement in connection with an election . -Whoever with intent to affect the result of an election makes or publishes any statement purporting to be a statement of fact which is false and which he either knows or believes to be false or does not believe to be true, in relation to the personal character or conduct of any candidate shall be punished with fine.
texts.text: 171G. False statement in connection with an election . -Whoever with intent to affect the result of an election makes or publishes any statement purporting to be a statement of fact which is false and which he either knows or believes to be false or does not believe to be true, in relation to the personal character or conduct of any candidate shall be punished with fine.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 171H. Illegal payments in connection with an election . -Whoever without the general or special authority in writing of a candidate incurs or authorises expenses on account of the holding of any public meeting,  or  upon  any  advertisement,  circular  or  publication,  or  in  any  other  way  whatsoever  for  the purpose of promoting or procuring the election of such candidate, shall be punished with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees:
texts.text: 171H. Illegal payments in connection with an election . -Whoever without the general or special authority in writing of a candidate incurs or authorises expenses on account of the holding of any public meeting,  or  upon  any  advertisement,  circular  or  publication,  or  in  any  other  way  whatsoever  for  the purpose of promoting or procuring the election of such candidate, shall be punished with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Provided  that  if  any  person  having  incurred  any  such  expenses  not  exceeding  the  amount  of  ten rupees without authority obtains within ten days from the date on which such expenses were incurred the approval in writing of the candidate, he shall be deemed to have incurred such expenses with the authority of the candidate.
texts.text: Provided  that  if  any  person  having  incurred  any  such  expenses  not  exceeding  the  amount  of  ten rupees without authority obtains within ten days from the date on which such expenses were incurred the approval in writing of the candidate, he shall be deemed to have incurred such expenses with the authority of the candidate.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 171-I. Failure to keep election accounts . -Whoever being required by any law for the time being in force or any rule having the force of law to keep accounts of expenses incurred at or in connection with an election fails to keep such accounts shall be punished with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees.]
texts.text: 171-I. Failure to keep election accounts . -Whoever being required by any law for the time being in force or any rule having the force of law to keep accounts of expenses incurred at or in connection with an election fails to keep such accounts shall be punished with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees.]

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CHAPTER X
texts.text: CHAPTER X

texts.label: text
texts.orig: OF CONTEMPTSOF THE LAWFUL AUTHORITYOF PUBLIC SERVANTS
texts.text: OF CONTEMPTSOF THE LAWFUL AUTHORITYOF PUBLIC SERVANTS

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 172. Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding . -Whoever absconds in order to  avoid  being  served  with  a  summons,  notice  or  order  proceeding  from  any  public  servant  legally competent, as such public servant, to issue such summons, notice or order, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both;
texts.text: Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding . -Whoever absconds in order to  avoid  being  served  with  a  summons,  notice  or  order  proceeding  from  any  public  servant  legally competent, as such public servant, to issue such summons, notice or order, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: or, if the summons or notice or order is to attend in person or by agent, or to 1 [produce a document or an electronic record in a Court of Justice], with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: or, if the summons or notice or order is to attend in person or by agent, or to 1 [produce a document or an electronic record in a Court of Justice], with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 173. Preventing service of summons or other proceeding, or preventing publication thereof . -Whoever in any manner intentionally  prevents  the  serving  on  himself,  or  on  any  other  person,  of  any summons, notice or order proceeding from any public servant legally competent, as such public servant, to issue such summons, notice or order,
texts.text: Preventing service of summons or other proceeding, or preventing publication thereof . -Whoever in any manner intentionally  prevents  the  serving  on  himself,  or  on  any  other  person,  of  any summons, notice or order proceeding from any public servant legally competent, as such public servant, to issue such summons, notice or order,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: or intentionally prevents the lawful affixing to any place of any such summons, notice or order,

texts.orig: or intentionally removes any such summons, notice or order from any place to which it is lawfully affixed,
texts.text: or intentionally removes any such summons, notice or order from any place to which it is lawfully affixed,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: or intentionally prevents the lawful making of any proclamation, under the authority of any public servant legally competent, as such public servant, to direct such proclamation to be made,
texts.text: or intentionally prevents the lawful making of any proclamation, under the authority of any public servant legally competent, as such public servant, to direct such proclamation to be made,

texts.text: shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 174.  Non-attendance  in  obedience  to  an  order  from  public  servant . -Whoever,  being  legally bound to attend in person or by an agent at a certain place and time in obedience to a summons, notice, order, or proclamation proceeding from any public servant legally competent, as such public servant, to issue the same,
texts.text: Non-attendance  in  obedience  to  an  order  from  public  servant . -Whoever,  being  legally bound to attend in person or by an agent at a certain place and time in obedience to a summons, notice, order, or proclamation proceeding from any public servant legally competent, as such public servant, to issue the same,

texts.label: text

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Illustrations
texts.text: Illustrations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( a )  A,  being  legally  bound  to  appear  before  the 1 [High Court] at Calcutta, in obedience to a subpoena issuing from that Court, intentionally omits to appear. A has committed the offence defined in this section.
texts.text: ( a )  A,  being  legally  bound  to  appear  before  the 1 [High Court] at Calcutta, in obedience to a subpoena issuing from that Court, intentionally omits to appear. A has committed the offence defined in this section.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( b )  A,  being  legally  bound  to  appear  before  a 2 [District  Judge],  as  a  witness,  in  obedience  to  a  summons  issued  by  that 2 [District Judge] intentionally omits to appear. A has committed the offence defined in this section.
texts.text: ( b )  A,  being  legally  bound  to  appear  before  a 2 [District  Judge],  as  a  witness,  in  obedience  to  a  summons  issued  by  that 2 [District Judge] intentionally omits to appear. A has committed the offence defined in this section.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 [174A .Non-appearance in response to a proclamation under  section  82  of  Act  2  of  1974 . -Whoever  fails  to  appear  at  the  specified  place  and  the  specified  time  as  required  by  a  proclamation published under sub-section ( 1 ) of section 82 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years or with fine or with both, and where a declaration  has  been  made  under  sub-section  ( 4 )  of  that  section  pronouncing  him  as  a  proclaimed offender, he shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.]
texts.text: 3 [174A .Non-appearance in response to a proclamation under  section  82  of  Act  2  of  1974 . -Whoever  fails  to  appear  at  the  specified  place  and  the  specified  time  as  required  by  a  proclamation published under sub-section ( 1 ) of section 82 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years or with fine or with both, and where a declaration  has  been  made  under  sub-section  ( 4 )  of  that  section  pronouncing  him  as  a  proclaimed offender, he shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 175. Omission to produce document to public servant by person legally bound to produce it . -Whoever, being legally bound to produce or deliver up any 4 [document or electronic record] to any public servant, as such, intentionally omits so to produce or deliver up the same, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both;
texts.text: Omission to produce document to public servant by person legally bound to produce it . -Whoever, being legally bound to produce or deliver up any 4 [document or electronic record] to any public servant, as such, intentionally omits so to produce or deliver up the same, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: or, if the 4 [document or electronic record] is to be produced or delivered up to a Court of Justice, with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: or, if the 4 [document or electronic record] is to be produced or delivered up to a Court of Justice, with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Illustration
texts.text: Illustration

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A, being legally bound to produce a document before a 5 [District Court], intentionally omits to produce the same. A has committed the offence defined in this section.
texts.text: A, being legally bound to produce a document before a 5 [District Court], intentionally omits to produce the same. A has committed the offence defined in this section.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 176. Omission to give notice or information to public servant by person legally bound to give it . -Whoever, being legally bound to give any notice or to furnish information  on  any  subject  to any public  servant,  as  such,  intentionally  omits  to  give  such  notice  or  to  furnish  such  information  in  the manner and at the time required by law, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both;
texts.text: Omission to give notice or information to public servant by person legally bound to give it . -Whoever, being legally bound to give any notice or to furnish information  on  any  subject  to any public  servant,  as  such,  intentionally  omits  to  give  such  notice  or  to  furnish  such  information  in  the manner and at the time required by law, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: or,  if  the  notice  or  information  required  to  be  given  respects  the  commission  of  an  offence,  or  is required for the purpose of preventing the commission of an offence, or in order to the apprehension of an offender, with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both;
texts.text: or,  if  the  notice  or  information  required  to  be  given  respects  the  commission  of  an  offence,  or  is required for the purpose of preventing the commission of an offence, or in order to the apprehension of an offender, with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6 [or,  if  the  notice  or  information  required  to  be  given  is  required  by  an  order  passed  under sub-section ( 1 ) of section 565 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (5 of 1898), with imprisonment of either  description  for  a  term  which  may  extend  to  six  months,  or  with  fine  which  may  extend  to  one thousand rupees, or with both.]
texts.text: 6 [or,  if  the  notice  or  information  required  to  be  given  is  required  by  an  order  passed  under sub-section ( 1 ) of section 565 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (5 of 1898), with imprisonment of either  description  for  a  term  which  may  extend  to  six  months,  or  with  fine  which  may  extend  to  one thousand rupees, or with both.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 177. Furnishing false information . -Whoever, being legally bound to furnish information on any subject to any public servant, as such, furnishes, as true, information on the subject which he knows or has reason to believe to be false shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both;
texts.text: Furnishing false information . -Whoever, being legally bound to furnish information on any subject to any public servant, as such, furnishes, as true, information on the subject which he knows or has reason to believe to be false shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both;

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Illustrations
texts.text: Illustrations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( a )  A,  a  landholder,  knowing  of  the  commission  of  a  murder  within  the  limits  of  his  estate,  wilfully  misinforms  the Magistrate of the district that the death has occurred by accident in consequence of the bite of a snake. A is guilty of the offence defined in this section.
texts.text: ( a )  A,  a  landholder,  knowing  of  the  commission  of  a  murder  within  the  limits  of  his  estate,  wilfully  misinforms  the Magistrate of the district that the death has occurred by accident in consequence of the bite of a snake. A is guilty of the offence defined in this section.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: ( b ) A, a village watchman, knowing that a considerable body of strangers has passed through his village in order to commit a dacoity in the house of Z, a wealthy merchant residing in a neighbouring place, and being bound under clause 5, section VII, 1 Regulation III, 1821, of the Bengal Code, to give early and punctual information of the above fact to the officer of the nearest police-station, wilfully misinforms the police officer that a body of suspicious characters passed through the village with a view to commit dacoity in a certain distant place in a different direction. Here A is guilty of the offence defined in the latter part of this section.
texts.text: ( b ) A, a village watchman, knowing that a considerable body of strangers has passed through his village in order to commit a dacoity in the house of Z, a wealthy merchant residing in a neighbouring place, and being bound under clause 5, section VII, 1 Regulation III, 1821, of the Bengal Code, to give early and punctual information of the above fact to the officer of the nearest police-station, wilfully misinforms the police officer that a body of suspicious characters passed through the village with a view to commit dacoity in a certain distant place in a different direction. Here A is guilty of the offence defined in the latter part of this section.

texts.orig: 2 [ Explanation . -In section 176 and in this section the word ' offence ' includes any act committed at any place out of 3 [India], which, if committed in 3 [India], would be punishable under any of the following sections, namely, 302, 304, 382, 392, 393, 394, 395, 396, 397, 398, 399, 402, 435, 436, 449, 450, 457, 458, 459 and 460; and the word ' offender ' includes any person who is alleged to have been guilty of any such act.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 178. Refusing oath or affirmation when duly required by public servant to make it . -Whoever refuses to bind himself by an oath 4 [or affirmation] to state the truth, when required so to bind himself by a public servant legally competent to require that he shall so bind himself, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Refusing oath or affirmation when duly required by public servant to make it . -Whoever refuses to bind himself by an oath 4 [or affirmation] to state the truth, when required so to bind himself by a public servant legally competent to require that he shall so bind himself, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 179. Refusing to answer public servant authorised to question . -Whoever, being legally bound to state  the  truth  on  any  subject  to  any  public  servant,  refuses  to  answer  any  question  demanded  of  him touching that subject by such public servant in the exercise of the legal powers of such public servant, shall  be  punished  with  simple  imprisonment  for  a term  which  may  extend  to six  months,  or  with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Refusing to answer public servant authorised to question . -Whoever, being legally bound to state  the  truth  on  any  subject  to  any  public  servant,  refuses  to  answer  any  question  demanded  of  him touching that subject by such public servant in the exercise of the legal powers of such public servant, shall  be  punished  with  simple  imprisonment  for  a term  which  may  extend  to six  months,  or  with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 180.  Refusing  to  sign  statement . -Whoever  refuses  to  sign  any  statement  made  by  him,  when required  to  sign  that  statement  by  a  public  servant  legally  competent  to  require  that  he  shall  sign  that statement, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Refusing  to  sign  statement . -Whoever  refuses  to  sign  any  statement  made  by  him,  when required  to  sign  that  statement  by  a  public  servant  legally  competent  to  require  that  he  shall  sign  that statement, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 181.  False  statement  on  oath  or  affirmation  to  public  servant  or  person  authorised  to administer an oath or affirmation . -Whoever, being legally bound by an oath 4 [or affirmation] to state the truth on any subject to any public servant or other person authorized by law to administer such oath 4 [or affirmation], makes, to such public servant or other person as aforesaid, touching that subject, any statement which is false, and which he either knows or believes to be false or does not believe to be true, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.
texts.text: False  statement  on  oath  or  affirmation  to  public  servant  or  person  authorised  to administer an oath or affirmation . -Whoever, being legally bound by an oath 4 [or affirmation] to state the truth on any subject to any public servant or other person authorized by law to administer such oath 4 [or affirmation], makes, to such public servant or other person as aforesaid, touching that subject, any statement which is false, and which he either knows or believes to be false or does not believe to be true, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5 [ 182.  False  information,  with  intent  to  cause  public  servant  to  use  his  lawful  power  to  the injury of another person . -Whoever gives to any public servant any information which he knows or believes to be false, intending thereby to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, such public servant -
texts.text: 5 [ 182.  False  information,  with  intent  to  cause  public  servant  to  use  his  lawful  power  to  the injury of another person . -Whoever gives to any public servant any information which he knows or believes to be false, intending thereby to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, such public servant -

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( a ) to do or omit anything which such public servant ought not to do or omit if the true state of facts respecting which such information is given were known by him, or
texts.text: ( a ) to do or omit anything which such public servant ought not to do or omit if the true state of facts respecting which such information is given were known by him, or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( b ) to use the lawful power of such public servant to the injury or annoyance of any person,
texts.text: ( b ) to use the lawful power of such public servant to the injury or annoyance of any person,
