texts.orig: the  same,  or  offers  or  exposes  it  for  sale,  or  issues  it  from  any  dispensary  for  medicinal  purposes  as unadulterated,  or  causes  it  to  be  used  for  medicinal  purposes  by  any  person  not  knowing  of  the adulteration, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: the  same,  or  offers  or  exposes  it  for  sale,  or  issues  it  from  any  dispensary  for  medicinal  purposes  as unadulterated,  or  causes  it  to  be  used  for  medicinal  purposes  by  any  person  not  knowing  of  the adulteration, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 276.  Sale  of  drug  as  a  different  drug  or  preparation . -Whoever  knowingly  sells,  or  offers  or exposes for sale, or issues from a dispensary for medicinal purposes, any drug or medical preparation, as a different  drug  or  medical  preparation,  shall  be  punished  with  imprisonment  of  either  description  for  a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Sale  of  drug  as  a  different  drug  or  preparation . -Whoever  knowingly  sells,  or  offers  or exposes for sale, or issues from a dispensary for medicinal purposes, any drug or medical preparation, as a different  drug  or  medical  preparation,  shall  be  punished  with  imprisonment  of  either  description  for  a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 277. Fouling water of public spring or reservoir . -Whoever voluntarily corrupts or fouls the water of any public spring or reservoir, so as to render it less fit for the purpose for which it is ordinarily used, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Fouling water of public spring or reservoir . -Whoever voluntarily corrupts or fouls the water of any public spring or reservoir, so as to render it less fit for the purpose for which it is ordinarily used, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 278. Making atmosphere noxious to health . -Whoever voluntarily vitiates the atmosphere in any place so as to make it noxious to the health of persons in general dwelling or carrying on business in the neighbourhood  or  passing  along  a  public  way,  shall  be  punished  with  fine  which  may  extend  to  five hundred rupees.
texts.text: Making atmosphere noxious to health . -Whoever voluntarily vitiates the atmosphere in any place so as to make it noxious to the health of persons in general dwelling or carrying on business in the neighbourhood  or  passing  along  a  public  way,  shall  be  punished  with  fine  which  may  extend  to  five hundred rupees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 279. Rash driving or riding on a public way . -Whoever drives any vehicle, or rides, on any public way in a manner so rash or negligent as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Rash driving or riding on a public way . -Whoever drives any vehicle, or rides, on any public way in a manner so rash or negligent as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 280. Rash navigation of vessel . -Whoever navigates any vessel in a manner so rash or negligent as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Rash navigation of vessel . -Whoever navigates any vessel in a manner so rash or negligent as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 281.  Exhibition  of  false  light,  mark  or  buoy . -Whoever exhibits  any  false  light,  mark  or  buoy, intending or knowing it to be likely that such exhibition will mislead any navigator, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Exhibition  of  false  light,  mark  or  buoy . -Whoever exhibits  any  false  light,  mark  or  buoy, intending or knowing it to be likely that such exhibition will mislead any navigator, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 282. Conveying person by water for hire in unsafe or overloaded vessel . -Whoever knowingly or negligently  conveys,  or  causes  to  be  conveyed  for  hire,  any  person  by  water  in  any  vessel,  when  that vessel  is  in  such  a  state  or  so  loaded  as  to  endanger  the  life  of  that  person,  shall  be  punished  with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Conveying person by water for hire in unsafe or overloaded vessel . -Whoever knowingly or negligently  conveys,  or  causes  to  be  conveyed  for  hire,  any  person  by  water  in  any  vessel,  when  that vessel  is  in  such  a  state  or  so  loaded  as  to  endanger  the  life  of  that  person,  shall  be  punished  with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 283. Danger or obstruction in public way or line of navigation . -Whoever, by doing any act, or by  omitting  to  take  order  with  any  property  in  his  possession  or  under  his  charge,  causes  danger, obstruction or injury to any person in any public way or public line of navigation, shall be punished, with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees.
texts.text: Danger or obstruction in public way or line of navigation . -Whoever, by doing any act, or by  omitting  to  take  order  with  any  property  in  his  possession  or  under  his  charge,  causes  danger, obstruction or injury to any person in any public way or public line of navigation, shall be punished, with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 284. Negligent conduct with respect to poisonous substance . -Whoever does, with any poisonous substance, any act in a manner so rash or negligent as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any person,
texts.text: Negligent conduct with respect to poisonous substance . -Whoever does, with any poisonous substance, any act in a manner so rash or negligent as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any person,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: or knowingly or negligently omits to take such order with any poisonous substance in his possession as is sufficient to guard against any probable danger to human life from such poisonous substance,
texts.text: or knowingly or negligently omits to take such order with any poisonous substance in his possession as is sufficient to guard against any probable danger to human life from such poisonous substance,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 285. Negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter . -Whoever does, with fire or any combustible matter, any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person,
texts.text: Negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter . -Whoever does, with fire or any combustible matter, any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: or knowingly or negligently omits to take such order with any fire or any combustible matter in his possession  as  is  sufficient  to  guard  against  any  probable  danger  to  human  life  from  such  fire  or combustible matter, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: or knowingly or negligently omits to take such order with any fire or any combustible matter in his possession  as  is  sufficient  to  guard  against  any  probable  danger  to  human  life  from  such  fire  or combustible matter, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 286. Negligent conduct with respect to explosive substance . -Whoever does, with any explosive substance, any act so rashly or  negligently as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person,
texts.text: Negligent conduct with respect to explosive substance . -Whoever does, with any explosive substance, any act so rashly or  negligently as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: or knowingly or negligently omits to take such order with any explosive substance in his possession as is sufficient to guard against any probable danger to human life from that substance,
texts.text: or knowingly or negligently omits to take such order with any explosive substance in his possession as is sufficient to guard against any probable danger to human life from that substance,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 287. Negligent conduct with respect to machinery . -Whoever does, with any machinery, any act so  rashly  or  negligently  as  to  endanger  human  life  or  to  be  likely  to  cause  hurt  or  injury  to  any  other person,
texts.text: Negligent conduct with respect to machinery . -Whoever does, with any machinery, any act so  rashly  or  negligently  as  to  endanger  human  life  or  to  be  likely  to  cause  hurt  or  injury  to  any  other person,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: or knowingly or negligently omits to take such order with any machinery in his possession or under his care as is sufficient to guard against any probable danger to human life from such machinery, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: or knowingly or negligently omits to take such order with any machinery in his possession or under his care as is sufficient to guard against any probable danger to human life from such machinery, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 288.  Negligent  conduct  with  respect  to  pulling  down  or  repairing  buildings . -Whoever,  in pulling  down  or  repairing  any  building,  knowingly  or  negligently  omits  to  take  such  order  with  that building as is sufficient to guard against any probable danger to human life from the fall of that building, or of any part thereof, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Negligent  conduct  with  respect  to  pulling  down  or  repairing  buildings . -Whoever,  in pulling  down  or  repairing  any  building,  knowingly  or  negligently  omits  to  take  such  order  with  that building as is sufficient to guard against any probable danger to human life from the fall of that building, or of any part thereof, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 289. Negligent conduct with respect to animal . -Whoever knowingly or negligently omits to take such  order  with  any  animal  in  his  possession  as  is  sufficient  to  guard  against  any  probable  danger  to human  life,  or  any  probable  danger  of  grievous  hurt  from  such  animal,  shall  be  punished  with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
texts.text: Negligent conduct with respect to animal . -Whoever knowingly or negligently omits to take such  order  with  any  animal  in  his  possession  as  is  sufficient  to  guard  against  any  probable  danger  to human  life,  or  any  probable  danger  of  grievous  hurt  from  such  animal,  shall  be  punished  with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 290. Punishment for public nuisance in cases not otherwise provided for . -Whoever commits a public nuisance in any case not otherwise punishable by this Code, shall be punished with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees.
texts.text: Punishment for public nuisance in cases not otherwise provided for . -Whoever commits a public nuisance in any case not otherwise punishable by this Code, shall be punished with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 291. Continuance of nuisance after injunction to discontinue . -Whoever repeats or continues a public  nuisance,  having  been  enjoined  by  any  public  servant  who  has  lawful  authority  to  issue  such injunction not to repeat or continue such nuisance, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Continuance of nuisance after injunction to discontinue . -Whoever repeats or continues a public  nuisance,  having  been  enjoined  by  any  public  servant  who  has  lawful  authority  to  issue  such injunction not to repeat or continue such nuisance, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 [ 292. Sale, etc., of obscene books, etc . -2 [( 1 ) For the purposes of sub-section ( 2 ), a book, pamphlet, paper,  writing,  drawing,  painting,  representation,  figure  or  any  other  object,  shall  be  deemed  to  be obscene if it is lascivious or appeals to the prurient interest or if its effect, or (where it comprises two or more distinct items) the effect of any one of its items, is, if taken as a whole, such as to tend to deprave and corrupt persons who are likely, having regard to all relevant circumstances, to read, see or hear the matter contained or embodied in it.]
texts.text: 1 [ 292. Sale, etc., of obscene books, etc . -2 [( 1 ) For the purposes of sub-section ( 2 ), a book, pamphlet, paper,  writing,  drawing,  painting,  representation,  figure  or  any  other  object,  shall  be  deemed  to  be obscene if it is lascivious or appeals to the prurient interest or if its effect, or (where it comprises two or more distinct items) the effect of any one of its items, is, if taken as a whole, such as to tend to deprave and corrupt persons who are likely, having regard to all relevant circumstances, to read, see or hear the matter contained or embodied in it.]

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CHAPTER XV
texts.text: CHAPTER XV

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: OF OFFENCESRELATING TO RELIGION
texts.text: OF OFFENCESRELATING TO RELIGION

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 295.  Injuring  or  defiling  place  of  worship,  with  intent  to  insult  the  religion  of  any  class . -Whoever destroys, damages or defiles any place of worship, or any object held sacred by any class of persons with the intention of thereby insulting the religion of any class of persons or with the knowledge that any class of persons is likely to consider such destruction, damage or defilement as an insult to their religion, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: 295.  Injuring  or  defiling  place  of  worship,  with  intent  to  insult  the  religion  of  any  class . -Whoever destroys, damages or defiles any place of worship, or any object held sacred by any class of persons with the intention of thereby insulting the religion of any class of persons or with the knowledge that any class of persons is likely to consider such destruction, damage or defilement as an insult to their religion, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 1 [295A.  Deliberate  and  malicious  acts,  intended  to  outrage  religious  feelings  of  any  class  by insulting  its  religion  or  religious  beliefs . -Whoever,  with  deliberate  and  malicious  intention  of outraging the religious feelings of any class of 2 [citizens of India], 3 [by words, either spoken or written, or or  by  signs  or  by  visible  representations  or  otherwise],  insults  or  attempts  to  insult  the  religion  or  the religious beliefs of that class, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to 4 [three years], or with fine, or with both.]
texts.text: 1 [295A.  Deliberate  and  malicious  acts,  intended  to  outrage  religious  feelings  of  any  class  by insulting  its  religion  or  religious  beliefs . -Whoever,  with  deliberate  and  malicious  intention  of outraging the religious feelings of any class of 2 [citizens of India], 3 [by words, either spoken or written, or or  by  signs  or  by  visible  representations  or  otherwise],  insults  or  attempts  to  insult  the  religion  or  the religious beliefs of that class, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to 4 [three years], or with fine, or with both.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 296.  Disturbing  religious  assembly . -Whoever  voluntarily  causes  disturbance  to  any  assembly lawfully engaged in the performance of religious worship, or religious ceremonies, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Disturbing  religious  assembly . -Whoever  voluntarily  causes  disturbance  to  any  assembly lawfully engaged in the performance of religious worship, or religious ceremonies, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 297. Trespassing on burial places, etc . -Whoever, with the intention of wounding the feelings of any  person,  or  of  insulting  the  religion  of  any  person  or  with  the  knowledge  that  the  feelings  of  any person are likely to be wounded, or that the religion of any person is likely to be insulted thereby,
texts.text: Trespassing on burial places, etc . -Whoever, with the intention of wounding the feelings of any  person,  or  of  insulting  the  religion  of  any  person  or  with  the  knowledge  that  the  feelings  of  any person are likely to be wounded, or that the religion of any person is likely to be insulted thereby,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: commits any trespass in any place of worship or on any place of sepulture, or any place set apart for the performance of funeral rites or as a depository for the remains of the dead, or offers any indignity to any  human  corpse,  or  causes  disturbance  to  any  persons  assembled  for  the  performance  of  funeral ceremonies, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: commits any trespass in any place of worship or on any place of sepulture, or any place set apart for the performance of funeral rites or as a depository for the remains of the dead, or offers any indignity to any  human  corpse,  or  causes  disturbance  to  any  persons  assembled  for  the  performance  of  funeral ceremonies, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 298. Uttering words, etc., with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings . -Whoever, with the deliberate intention of wounding the religious feelings of any person, utters any word or makes any sound in the hearing of that person or makes any gesture in the sight of that persons or places any object in the sight  of  that  person,  shall  be  punished  with  imprisonment  of  either  description  for  a  term  which  may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Uttering words, etc., with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings . -Whoever, with the deliberate intention of wounding the religious feelings of any person, utters any word or makes any sound in the hearing of that person or makes any gesture in the sight of that persons or places any object in the sight  of  that  person,  shall  be  punished  with  imprisonment  of  either  description  for  a  term  which  may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CHAPTER XVI
texts.text: CHAPTER XVI

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: OF OFFENCESAFFECTINGTHE HUMAN BODY
texts.text: OF OFFENCESAFFECTINGTHE HUMAN BODY

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Of offences affecting life
texts.text: Of offences affecting life

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 299.  Culpable  homicide . -Whoever  causes  death  by  doing  an  act  with  the  intention  of  causing death,  or  with  the  intention  of  causing  such  bodily  injury  as  is  likely  to  cause  death,  or  with  the knowledge that he is likely by such act to cause death, commits the offence of culpable homicide.
texts.text: 299.  Culpable  homicide . -Whoever  causes  death  by  doing  an  act  with  the  intention  of  causing death,  or  with  the  intention  of  causing  such  bodily  injury  as  is  likely  to  cause  death,  or  with  the knowledge that he is likely by such act to cause death, commits the offence of culpable homicide.

texts.orig: 1. Ins. by Act 25 of 1927, s. 2.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Illustrations
texts.text: Illustrations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( a ) A lays sticks and turf over a pit, with the intention of thereby causing death, or with the knowledge that death is likely to be thereby caused. Z, believing the ground to be firm, treads on it, falls in and is killed. A has committed the offence of culpable homicide.
texts.text: ( a ) A lays sticks and turf over a pit, with the intention of thereby causing death, or with the knowledge that death is likely to be thereby caused. Z, believing the ground to be firm, treads on it, falls in and is killed. A has committed the offence of culpable homicide.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( b ) A knows Z to be behind a bush. B does not know it. A, intending to cause, or knowing it to be likely to cause Z's death, induces B to fire at the bush. B fires and kills Z. Here B may be guilty of no offence; but A has committed the offence of culpable homicide.
texts.text: ( b ) A knows Z to be behind a bush. B does not know it. A, intending to cause, or knowing it to be likely to cause Z's death, induces B to fire at the bush. B fires and kills Z. Here B may be guilty of no offence; but A has committed the offence of culpable homicide.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( c ) A, by shooting at a fowl with intent to kill and steal it, kills B, who is behind a bush; A not knowing that he was there. Here, although A was doing an unlawful act, he was not guilty of culpable homicide, as he did not intend to kill B, or to cause death by doing an act that he knew was likely to cause death.
texts.text: ( c ) A, by shooting at a fowl with intent to kill and steal it, kills B, who is behind a bush; A not knowing that he was there. Here, although A was doing an unlawful act, he was not guilty of culpable homicide, as he did not intend to kill B, or to cause death by doing an act that he knew was likely to cause death.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation 1. -A person who causes bodily injury to another who is labouring under a disorder, disease or bodily infirmity, and thereby accelerates the death of that other, shall be deemed to have caused his death.
texts.text: Explanation 1. -A person who causes bodily injury to another who is labouring under a disorder, disease or bodily infirmity, and thereby accelerates the death of that other, shall be deemed to have caused his death.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation 2. -Where death is caused by bodily injury, the person who causes such bodily injury shall be deemed to have caused the death, although by resorting to proper remedies and skilful treatment the death might have been prevented.
texts.text: Explanation 2. -Where death is caused by bodily injury, the person who causes such bodily injury shall be deemed to have caused the death, although by resorting to proper remedies and skilful treatment the death might have been prevented.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation 3. -The causing of the death of a child in the mother's womb is not homicide. But it may amount to culpable homicide to cause the death of a living child, if any part of that child has been brought forth, though the child may not have breathed or been completely born.
texts.text: Explanation 3. -The causing of the death of a child in the mother's womb is not homicide. But it may amount to culpable homicide to cause the death of a living child, if any part of that child has been brought forth, though the child may not have breathed or been completely born.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 300. Murder . -Except in the cases hereinafter excepted, culpable homicide is murder, if the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death, or -
texts.text: 300. Murder . -Except in the cases hereinafter excepted, culpable homicide is murder, if the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death, or -

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 2ndly . -If  it  is  done  with  the  intention  of  causing  such  bodily  injury  as  the  offender  knows  to  be likely to cause the death of the person to whom the harm is caused, or -
texts.text: 2ndly . -If  it  is  done  with  the  intention  of  causing  such  bodily  injury  as  the  offender  knows  to  be likely to cause the death of the person to whom the harm is caused, or -

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3rdly . -If it is done with the intention of causing bodily injury to any person and the bodily injury intended to be inflicted is sufficient in the ordinary course of nature to cause death, or -
texts.text: 3rdly . -If it is done with the intention of causing bodily injury to any person and the bodily injury intended to be inflicted is sufficient in the ordinary course of nature to cause death, or -

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4thly . -If the person committing the act knows that it is so imminently dangerous that it must, in all probability, cause death, or such bodily injury as is likely to cause death, and commits such act without any excuse for incurring the risk of causing death or such injury as aforesaid.
texts.text: 4thly . -If the person committing the act knows that it is so imminently dangerous that it must, in all probability, cause death, or such bodily injury as is likely to cause death, and commits such act without any excuse for incurring the risk of causing death or such injury as aforesaid.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Illustrations
texts.text: Illustrations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( a ) A shoots Z with the intention of killing him. Z dies in consequence. A commits murder.
texts.text: ( a ) A shoots Z with the intention of killing him. Z dies in consequence. A commits murder.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( b ) A, knowing that Z is labouring under such a disease that a blow is likely to cause his death, strikes him with the intention of  causing  bodily  injury.  Z  dies  in  consequence  of  the  blow.  A  is  guilty  of  murder,  although  the  blow  might  not  have  been sufficient in the ordinary course of nature to cause the death of a person in a sound state of health. But if A, not knowing that Z is labouring under any disease, gives him such a blow as would not in the ordinary course of nature kill a person in a sound state of health, here A, although he may intend to cause bodily injury, is not guilty of murder, if he did not intend to cause death, or such bodily injury as in the ordinary course of nature would cause death.
texts.text: ( b ) A, knowing that Z is labouring under such a disease that a blow is likely to cause his death, strikes him with the intention of  causing  bodily  injury.  Z  dies  in  consequence  of  the  blow.  A  is  guilty  of  murder,  although  the  blow  might  not  have  been sufficient in the ordinary course of nature to cause the death of a person in a sound state of health. But if A, not knowing that Z is labouring under any disease, gives him such a blow as would not in the ordinary course of nature kill a person in a sound state of health, here A, although he may intend to cause bodily injury, is not guilty of murder, if he did not intend to cause death, or such bodily injury as in the ordinary course of nature would cause death.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( c ) A intentionally gives Z a sword-cut or club-wound sufficient to cause the death of a man in the ordinary course of nature. Z dies in consequence. Here A is guilty of murder, although he may not have intended to cause Z's death.
texts.text: ( c ) A intentionally gives Z a sword-cut or club-wound sufficient to cause the death of a man in the ordinary course of nature. Z dies in consequence. Here A is guilty of murder, although he may not have intended to cause Z's death.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( d )  A  without  any  excuse  fires  a  loaded  cannon  into  a  crowd  of  persons  and  kills  one  of  them.  A  is  guilty  of  murder, although he may not have had a premeditated design to kill any particular individual.
texts.text: ( d )  A  without  any  excuse  fires  a  loaded  cannon  into  a  crowd  of  persons  and  kills  one  of  them.  A  is  guilty  of  murder, although he may not have had a premeditated design to kill any particular individual.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Exception 1 . -When culpable homicide is not murder . -Culpable homicide is not murder if the offender, whilst deprived of the power of self-control by grave and sudden provocation, causes the death of the person who gave the provocation or causes the death of any other person by mistake or accident.
texts.text: Exception 1 . -When culpable homicide is not murder . -Culpable homicide is not murder if the offender, whilst deprived of the power of self-control by grave and sudden provocation, causes the death of the person who gave the provocation or causes the death of any other person by mistake or accident.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The above exception is subject to the following provisos: -
texts.text: The above exception is subject to the following provisos: -

texts.label: text
texts.orig: First . -That the provocation is not sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for killing or doing harm to any person.
texts.text: First . -That the provocation is not sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for killing or doing harm to any person.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Secondly . -That the provocation is not given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.
texts.text: Secondly . -That the provocation is not given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Thirdly . -That the provocation is not given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.
texts.text: Thirdly . -That the provocation is not given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation . -Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to prevent the offence from amounting to murder is a question of fact.
texts.text: Explanation . -Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to prevent the offence from amounting to murder is a question of fact.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Illustrations
texts.text: Illustrations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( a ) A, under the influence of passion excited by a provocation given by Z, intentionally kills Y, Z's child. This is murder, inasmuch as the provocation was not given by the child, and the death of the child was not caused by accident or misfortune in doing an act caused by the provocation.
texts.text: ( a ) A, under the influence of passion excited by a provocation given by Z, intentionally kills Y, Z's child. This is murder, inasmuch as the provocation was not given by the child, and the death of the child was not caused by accident or misfortune in doing an act caused by the provocation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( b ) Y gives grave and sudden provocation to A. A, on this provocation, fires a pistol at Y, neither intending  nor knowing himself to be likely to kill Z, who is near him, but out of sight. A kills Z. Here A has not committed murder, but merely culpable homicide.
texts.text: ( b ) Y gives grave and sudden provocation to A. A, on this provocation, fires a pistol at Y, neither intending  nor knowing himself to be likely to kill Z, who is near him, but out of sight. A kills Z. Here A has not committed murder, but merely culpable homicide.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( c ) A is lawfully arrested by Z, a bailiff. A is excited to sudden and violent passion by the arrest, and kills Z. This is murder, inasmuch as the provocation was given by a thing done by a public servant in the exercise of his powers.
texts.text: ( c ) A is lawfully arrested by Z, a bailiff. A is excited to sudden and violent passion by the arrest, and kills Z. This is murder, inasmuch as the provocation was given by a thing done by a public servant in the exercise of his powers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( d ) A appears as a witness before Z, a Magistrate. Z says that he does not believe a word of A's deposition, and that A has perjured himself. A is moved to sudden passion by these words, and kills Z. This is murder.
texts.text: ( d ) A appears as a witness before Z, a Magistrate. Z says that he does not believe a word of A's deposition, and that A has perjured himself. A is moved to sudden passion by these words, and kills Z. This is murder.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( e )A attempts to pull Z's nose. Z, in the exercise of the right of private defence, lays hold of A to prevent him from doing so. A is moved to sudden and violent passion in consequence, and kills Z. This is murder, inasmuch as the provocation was giving by a thing done in the exercise of the right of private defence.
texts.text: ( e )A attempts to pull Z's nose. Z, in the exercise of the right of private defence, lays hold of A to prevent him from doing so. A is moved to sudden and violent passion in consequence, and kills Z. This is murder, inasmuch as the provocation was giving by a thing done in the exercise of the right of private defence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( f ) Z strikes B. B is by this provocation excited to violent rage. A, a bystander, intending to take advantage of B's rage, and to cause him to kill Z, puts a knife into B's hand for that purpose. B kills Z with the knife. Here B may have committed only culpable homicide, but A is guilty of murder.
texts.text: ( f ) Z strikes B. B is by this provocation excited to violent rage. A, a bystander, intending to take advantage of B's rage, and to cause him to kill Z, puts a knife into B's hand for that purpose. B kills Z with the knife. Here B may have committed only culpable homicide, but A is guilty of murder.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Exception 2 . -Culpable homicide is not murder if the offender in the exercise in good faith of the right  of  private  defence  of  person  or  property,  exceeds  the  power  given  to  him  by  law  and  causes  the death  of  the  person  against  whom  he  is  exercising  such  right  of  defence  without  premeditation,  and without any intention of doing more harm than is necessary for the purpose of such defence.
texts.text: Exception 2 . -Culpable homicide is not murder if the offender in the exercise in good faith of the right  of  private  defence  of  person  or  property,  exceeds  the  power  given  to  him  by  law  and  causes  the death  of  the  person  against  whom  he  is  exercising  such  right  of  defence  without  premeditation,  and without any intention of doing more harm than is necessary for the purpose of such defence.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Illustration
texts.text: Illustration

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Z attempts to horsewhip A, not in such a manner as to cause grievous hurt to A. A draws out a pistol. Z persists in the assault. A believing in good faith that he can by no other means prevent himself from being horsewhipped, shoots Z dead. A has not committed murder, but only culpable homicide.
texts.text: Z attempts to horsewhip A, not in such a manner as to cause grievous hurt to A. A draws out a pistol. Z persists in the assault. A believing in good faith that he can by no other means prevent himself from being horsewhipped, shoots Z dead. A has not committed murder, but only culpable homicide.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Exception 3 . -Culpable homicide is not murder if the offender, being a public servant or aiding a public servant acting for the advancement of public justice, exceeds the powers given to him by law, and causes death by doing an act which he, in good faith, believes to be lawful and necessary for the due discharge  of  his  duty  as  such  public  servant  and  without  ill-will  towards  the  person  whose  death  is caused.
texts.text: Exception 3 . -Culpable homicide is not murder if the offender, being a public servant or aiding a public servant acting for the advancement of public justice, exceeds the powers given to him by law, and causes death by doing an act which he, in good faith, believes to be lawful and necessary for the due discharge  of  his  duty  as  such  public  servant  and  without  ill-will  towards  the  person  whose  death  is caused.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Exception 4 . -Culpable homicide is not murder if it is committed without premeditation in a sudden fight  in  the  heat  of  passion  upon  a  sudden  quarrel  and  without  the  offender's  having  taken  undue advantage or acted in a cruel or unusual manner.
texts.text: Exception 4 . -Culpable homicide is not murder if it is committed without premeditation in a sudden fight  in  the  heat  of  passion  upon  a  sudden  quarrel  and  without  the  offender's  having  taken  undue advantage or acted in a cruel or unusual manner.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation . -It is immaterial in such cases which party offers the provocation or commits the first assault.
texts.text: Explanation . -It is immaterial in such cases which party offers the provocation or commits the first assault.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Exception 5 . -Culpable homicide is not murder when the person whose death is caused, being above the age of eighteen years, suffers death or takes the risk of death with his own consent.
texts.text: Exception 5 . -Culpable homicide is not murder when the person whose death is caused, being above the age of eighteen years, suffers death or takes the risk of death with his own consent.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Illustration
texts.text: Illustration

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A, by instigation, voluntarily causes Z, a person under eighteen years of age  to commit suicide. Here, on account of Z's youth, he was incapable of giving consent to his own death; A has therefore abetted murder.
texts.text: A, by instigation, voluntarily causes Z, a person under eighteen years of age  to commit suicide. Here, on account of Z's youth, he was incapable of giving consent to his own death; A has therefore abetted murder.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 301.  Culpable  homicide  by  causing  death  of  person  other  than  person  whose  death  was intended . -If  a  person,  by  doing  anything  which  he  intends  or  knows  to  be  likely  to  cause  death, commits culpable homicide by causing the death of any person, whose death he neither intends nor knows himself to be likely to cause, the culpable homicide committed by the offender is of the description of which it would have been if he had caused the death of the person whose death he intended  or knew himself to he likely to cause.
texts.text: Culpable  homicide  by  causing  death  of  person  other  than  person  whose  death  was intended . -If  a  person,  by  doing  anything  which  he  intends  or  knows  to  be  likely  to  cause  death, commits culpable homicide by causing the death of any person, whose death he neither intends nor knows himself to be likely to cause, the culpable homicide committed by the offender is of the description of which it would have been if he had caused the death of the person whose death he intended  or knew himself to he likely to cause.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 302.  Punishment  for  murder . -Whoever  commits  murder  shall  be  punished  with  death  or 1 [imprisonment for life], and shall also be liable to fine.
texts.text: Punishment  for  murder . -Whoever  commits  murder  shall  be  punished  with  death  or 1 [imprisonment for life], and shall also be liable to fine.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 303. Punishment for murder by life-convict . -Whoever, being under sentence of 1 [imprisonment for life], commits murder, shall be punished with death.
texts.text: Punishment for murder by life-convict . -Whoever, being under sentence of 1 [imprisonment for life], commits murder, shall be punished with death.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 304. Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder . -Whoever commits culpable homicide not amounting to murder, shall be punished with 1 [imprisonment for life], or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine, if the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death, or of causing such bodily injury as is likely to cause death;
texts.text: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder . -Whoever commits culpable homicide not amounting to murder, shall be punished with 1 [imprisonment for life], or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine, if the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death, or of causing such bodily injury as is likely to cause death;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, or with fine, or with both, if the act is done with the knowledge that it is likely to cause death, but without any intention to cause death, or to cause such bodily injury as is likely to cause death.
texts.text: or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, or with fine, or with both, if the act is done with the knowledge that it is likely to cause death, but without any intention to cause death, or to cause such bodily injury as is likely to cause death.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 [ 304A. Causing death by negligence . -Whoever causes the death of any person by doing any rash or  negligent  act  not  amounting  to  culpable  homicide,  shall  be  punished  with  imprisonment  of  either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.]
texts.text: 2 [ 304A. Causing death by negligence . -Whoever causes the death of any person by doing any rash or  negligent  act  not  amounting  to  culpable  homicide,  shall  be  punished  with  imprisonment  of  either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 [ 304B. Dowry death . -( 1 ) Where the death of a woman is caused by any burns or bodily injury or occurs otherwise than under normal circumstances within seven years of her marriage and it is shown that soon before her death she was subjected to cruelty or harassment by her husband or any relative of her husband for, or in connection with, any demand for dowry, such death shall be called ' dowry death ' , and such husband or relative shall be deemed to have caused her death.
texts.text: 3 [ 304B. Dowry death . -( 1 ) Where the death of a woman is caused by any burns or bodily injury or occurs otherwise than under normal circumstances within seven years of her marriage and it is shown that soon before her death she was subjected to cruelty or harassment by her husband or any relative of her husband for, or in connection with, any demand for dowry, such death shall be called ' dowry death ' , and such husband or relative shall be deemed to have caused her death.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation . -For  the  purposes  of  this  sub-section, ' dowry ' shall  have  the  same  meaning  as  in section 2 of the Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961 (28 of 1961).
texts.text: Explanation . -For  the  purposes  of  this  sub-section, ' dowry ' shall  have  the  same  meaning  as  in section 2 of the Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961 (28 of 1961).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( 2 ) Whoever commits dowry death shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than seven years but which may extend to imprisonment for life.]
texts.text: ( 2 ) Whoever commits dowry death shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than seven years but which may extend to imprisonment for life.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 305. Abetment of suicide of child or insane person . -If  any person under eighteen years of age, any  insane  person,  any  delirious  person,  any  idiot,  or  any  person  in  a  state  of  intoxication,  commits suicide, whoever abets the commission of such suicide, shall be punished with death or 1 [imprisonment for life], or imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
texts.text: Abetment of suicide of child or insane person . -If  any person under eighteen years of age, any  insane  person,  any  delirious  person,  any  idiot,  or  any  person  in  a  state  of  intoxication,  commits suicide, whoever abets the commission of such suicide, shall be punished with death or 1 [imprisonment for life], or imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 306. Abetment of suicide . -If any person commits suicide, whoever abets the commission of such suicide, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
texts.text: Abetment of suicide . -If any person commits suicide, whoever abets the commission of such suicide, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 307. Attempt to murder . -Whoever does any act with such intention or knowledge, and under such circumstances that, if he by that act caused death, he would be guilty of murder, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if hurt is caused to any person by such act, the offender shall be liable either to 1 [imprisonment for life], or to such punishment as is hereinbefore mentioned.
texts.text: Attempt to murder . -Whoever does any act with such intention or knowledge, and under such circumstances that, if he by that act caused death, he would be guilty of murder, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if hurt is caused to any person by such act, the offender shall be liable either to 1 [imprisonment for life], or to such punishment as is hereinbefore mentioned.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Attempts by life-convicts . -4 [When any person offending under this section is under sentence  of 1 [imprisonment for life], he may, if hurt is caused, be punished with death.]
texts.text: Attempts by life-convicts . -4 [When any person offending under this section is under sentence  of 1 [imprisonment for life], he may, if hurt is caused, be punished with death.]

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Illustrations
texts.text: Illustrations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( a ) A shoots at Z with intention to kill him, under such circumstances that, if death ensued A would be guilty of murder. A is liable to punishment under this section.
texts.text: ( a ) A shoots at Z with intention to kill him, under such circumstances that, if death ensued A would be guilty of murder. A is liable to punishment under this section.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( b ) A, with the intention of causing the death of a child of tender years, exposes it in a desert place A has committed the offence defined by this section, though the death of the child does not ensue.
texts.text: ( b ) A, with the intention of causing the death of a child of tender years, exposes it in a desert place A has committed the offence defined by this section, though the death of the child does not ensue.

texts.label: footnote
texts.orig: 1. Subs. by Act 26 of 1955, s. 117 and the Sch., for 'transportation for life' (w.e.f. 1 -1-1956).
texts.text: 1. Subs. by Act 26 of 1955, s. 117 and the Sch., for 'transportation for life' (w.e.f. 1 -1-1956).

texts.label: footnote
texts.orig: 2. Ins. by Act 27 of 1870, s. 12.
texts.text: 2. Ins. by Act 27 of 1870, s. 12.

texts.label: footnote
texts.orig: 4. Added by Act 27 of 1870, s. 11.
texts.text: 4. Added by Act 27 of 1870, s. 11.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( c ) A, intending to murder Z, buys a gun and loads it. A has not yet committed the offence. A fires the gun at Z. He has committed the offence defined in this section, and, if by such firing he wounds Z, he is liable to the punishment provided by the latter part of 1 [the first paragraph of] this section.
texts.text: ( c ) A, intending to murder Z, buys a gun and loads it. A has not yet committed the offence. A fires the gun at Z. He has committed the offence defined in this section, and, if by such firing he wounds Z, he is liable to the punishment provided by the latter part of 1 [the first paragraph of] this section.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ( d ) A, intending to murder Z by poison, purchases poison and mixes the same with food which remains in A's keeping; A has not yet committed the offence defined in this section. A places the food on Z's table or delivers it to Z's servants to place it on Z's table. A has committed the offence defined in this section.
texts.text: ( d ) A, intending to murder Z by poison, purchases poison and mixes the same with food which remains in A's keeping; A has not yet committed the offence defined in this section. A places the food on Z's table or delivers it to Z's servants to place it on Z's table. A has committed the offence defined in this section.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 308.  Attempt  to  commit  culpable  homicide . -Whoever  does  any  act  with  such  intention  or knowledge  and  under  such  circumstances  that,  if  he  by  that  act  caused  death,  he  would  be  guilty  of culpable homicide not amounting to murder, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both; and, if hurt is caused to any person by such act, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.
texts.text: Attempt  to  commit  culpable  homicide . -Whoever  does  any  act  with  such  intention  or knowledge  and  under  such  circumstances  that,  if  he  by  that  act  caused  death,  he  would  be  guilty  of culpable homicide not amounting to murder, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both; and, if hurt is caused to any person by such act, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Illustration
texts.text: Illustration

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A, on grave and sudden provocation, fires a pistol at Z, under such circumstances that if he there by caused death he would be guilty of culpable homicide not amounting to murder. A has committed the offence defined in this section.
texts.text: A, on grave and sudden provocation, fires a pistol at Z, under such circumstances that if he there by caused death he would be guilty of culpable homicide not amounting to murder. A has committed the offence defined in this section.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 309. Attempt to commit suicide . -Whoever attempts to commit suicide and does any act towards the  commission  of  such  offence,  shall  be  punished  with  simple  imprisonment  for  a  term  which  may extend to one year 2 [or with fine, or with both.]
texts.text: Attempt to commit suicide . -Whoever attempts to commit suicide and does any act towards the  commission  of  such  offence,  shall  be  punished  with  simple  imprisonment  for  a  term  which  may extend to one year 2 [or with fine, or with both.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 310. Thug . -Whoever, at any time after the passing of this Act, shall have been habitually associated with  any  other  or  others  for  the  purpose  of  committing  robbery  or  child-stealing  by  means  of  or accompanied with murder, is a thug.
texts.text: Thug . -Whoever, at any time after the passing of this Act, shall have been habitually associated with  any  other  or  others  for  the  purpose  of  committing  robbery  or  child-stealing  by  means  of  or accompanied with murder, is a thug.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 311. Punishment . -Whoever is a thug, shall be punished with 3 [imprisonment for life], and shall also be liable to fine.
texts.text: Punishment . -Whoever is a thug, shall be punished with 3 [imprisonment for life], and shall also be liable to fine.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Of the causing of miscarriage, of injuries to unborn children, of the exposure Of infants, and of the concealment of births.
texts.text: Of the causing of miscarriage, of injuries to unborn children, of the exposure Of infants, and of the concealment of births.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 312. Causing miscarraige . -Whoever voluntarily causes a woman with child to miscarry, shall, if such miscarriage be not caused in good faith for the purpose of saving the life of the woman, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both; and, if the woman be quick with child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.
texts.text: Causing miscarraige . -Whoever voluntarily causes a woman with child to miscarry, shall, if such miscarriage be not caused in good faith for the purpose of saving the life of the woman, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both; and, if the woman be quick with child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation . -A woman who causes herself to miscarry, is within the meaning of this section.
texts.text: Explanation . -A woman who causes herself to miscarry, is within the meaning of this section.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 313.  Causing  miscarriage  without woman's consent . -Whoever commits the offence defined in the last preceding section without the consent of the woman, whether the woman is quick with child or not, shall be punished with 3 [imprisonment for life], or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
texts.text: Causing  miscarriage  without woman's consent . -Whoever commits the offence defined in the last preceding section without the consent of the woman, whether the woman is quick with child or not, shall be punished with 3 [imprisonment for life], or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 314. Death caused by act done with intent to cause miscarriage . -Whoever, with intent to cause the  miscarriage  of  a  woman  with  child,  does  any  act  which causes the death  of  such  woman,  shall  be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine;
texts.text: Death caused by act done with intent to cause miscarriage . -Whoever, with intent to cause the  miscarriage  of  a  woman  with  child,  does  any  act  which causes the death  of  such  woman,  shall  be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: if  act  done without woman's consent . -and if the act is done without the consent of the woman, shall be punished either with 3 [imprisonment for life], or with the punishment above mentioned.
texts.text: if  act  done without woman's consent . -and if the act is done without the consent of the woman, shall be punished either with 3 [imprisonment for life], or with the punishment above mentioned.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation . -It is not essential to this offence that the offender should know that the act is likely to cause death.
texts.text: Explanation . -It is not essential to this offence that the offender should know that the act is likely to cause death.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 315. Act done with intent to prevent child being born alive or to cause it to die after birth . -Whoever before the birth of any child does any act with the intention of thereby preventing that child from being born alive or causing it to die after its birth, and does by such act prevent that child from being
texts.text: Act done with intent to prevent child being born alive or to cause it to die after birth . -Whoever before the birth of any child does any act with the intention of thereby preventing that child from being born alive or causing it to die after its birth, and does by such act prevent that child from being

texts.orig: 1. Ins. by Act 12 of 1891, s. 2 and the Second Sch.
texts.text: 1. Ins. by Act 12 of 1891, s. 2 and the Second Sch.

texts.orig: 2. Subs. by Act 8 of 1882, s. 7, for 'and shall also be liable to fine'.
texts.text: 2. Subs. by Act 8 of 1882, s. 7, for 'and shall also be liable to fine'.
